SYN_3_2_1634: INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY NOTE: Mr. [REDACTED] is undergoing treatment for a complicated parapneumonic effusion. Diagnostic ultrasound of the right hemithorax confirmed the persistence of multiloculated fluid collections. To facilitate drainage, intrapleural fibrinolytic therapy was initiated. A solution containing 10mg tPA and 5mg DNase was instilled via the indwelling right chest tube. The tube was clamped to allow a 1-hour dwell time, after which it will be returned to suction.
